item.title: Visualizing A Million People
item.description: This article was formerly published as Visualizing Internet Users. This version is more generalized and up-to-date. What if you introduce a bug and/or a feature that pisses off a million people? The scenario isn’t all that hard to imagine these days if you work at a big tech company or even a small one with a considerable user base. It seems a million users aren’t all that hard to reach these days.

item.title: On WontFixing Bugs
item.description: This was partly inspired by a Tweet by a co-worker. The tweet is: wontfix-ing valid bugs (that have been triaged as such) with bots because you haven't been able to fix or prioritize them yet is kinda hostile to contributors, imho pic.twitter.com/faxtbpoiII — Mike Taylor (@miketaylr) March 2, 2021 For projects that are under-resourced but has heavy usage it is in fact quite normal to accumulate a large number of issue reports over time.
